section.title: Tutorial 1: Browsing FlyMine - running a quick search
section.para: This tutorial will guide you through running a quick search. The tutorial will show you how to run a quick search for the 'bib' gene.
The quick search allows you to access all the information that is available for a particular database entry and provides a good way to browse the database.

The quick search box is found in the top right of the FlyMine home page. You can use this to search for anything with an identifier or symbol, for example genes, proteins, transcripts or binding sites.

listitem.para: for the Drosophila gene zen, type FBgn0004053, CG1046, zen or any of its synonyms.
for A. gambiae genes, use Ensembl identifiers (eg. ENSANGG00000001499).
for C. elegans genes, use the WormBase identifiers or symbols (eg. M117.2, WBGene00003920, par-5).
for proteins use UniProt identifiers or primary accessions (eg. 18C_DROME, P16909).

section.para: Enter the gene symbol 'bib' into the search box and press 'Search':

Since one item in the database matches the term 'bib', you will be taken straight to the 'Object Details' page for the 'bib' gene. Navigating the object details page is described in more detail in Tutorial 2.

Wild cards (*) can be added to increase the range of a quick search. Enter 'bib*' into the search box and press 'Search'. This time the search term matches several items in the database and a summary list of these will be returned as your results.
